student_classes
Class Concordance

java.lang.Object
  student_classes.Concordance

public class Concordance
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Tom R: A Concordance is an object that embodies the association of tokens (words taken from a text) to their "context." This class defines "context" as the the number of times that a particular token (word) occurs in a document (which is a text file).

Clients of this class provide a complete pathname to a text file (.txt) and a boolean variable is_case_sensitive that determines whether tokens are stored in the original case or are converted to lowercase during the construction of the associations as well as during the retrieval of counts associated with particular tokens.

Clients may use the various methods on the Concordance object to retrieve information such as how many times a particular word occurred or lists of words that occurred a number of times.

Special characters, such as syntax marks, are ignored. It is possible, therefore, that hyphenated words or contractions will register incorrectly: For example: "can't" might be "can" "t." Certainly, developers of this class are encouraged to explore Java's regular expressions package to improve this implementation!

Constructor Detail

Concordance

public Concordance(java.lang.String pathName,
                   boolean is_case_sensitive)
Main Constructor: requires two parameters:

(1) pathName is a String representing a valid pathname, i.e., a pathname whose last component is the name of a "text file." Text files comprise normal characters and are assumed to have the suffix ".txt".

(2) is_case_sensitive, which is a boolean that determines if the capitalization of tokens matters. If the client specifies that is_case_sensitive is True, then the original case of all tokens will be preserved during the construction of the tables (associations) as well as during the retrieval of data that involves the comparison of tokens by the various public methods exposed by the Concordance object.

Parameters:
pathName - (String)
is_case_sensitive - (boolean)
Method Detail

getTokenCount

public int getTokenCount(java.lang.String for_token)

Given a (String) token, return how many times it occurred in the text.

Preconditions: The constructor has been successfully called.

Postconditions: a counting number is returned.

Note: this method is sensitive to the value of the is_case_sensitive parameter that the user specified during the construction of this instance. If the user specified that case was to be ignored, then all tokens have been installed and will be compared in lower case; otherwise, the original case of the token(s) as they were found in the document will be used.

getTokensByCount

public java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> getTokensByCount(int by_count)

Preconditions: The Constructor has successfully been called. Note: the by_count argument must be an integer greater than 0 or an Illegal Argument exception is thrown.

Postcondition: An Iterable object is returned that contains an unordered list of tokens (which are unique) whose counts equal by_count Note: this list could be empty, but should not be under ordinary circumstances.

Parameters:
by_count - (int > 0)
Returns:
Iterable An Iterable object (which may be empty) that contains the tokens whose counts equal the by_count (int) parameter.
